author: shemnon
msg: Bug #54 -- have JspC return an error code on failures
This is implemented via an optional switch "-die[#]" (like -die5)
However, I am fairly certian it does not go outside the
jspc.sh and jspc.bat shells, so you must call the JspC class
directly to get the die effect.
PR:54

author: costin
msg: - Fixed bug in ContextManager.createRequest() - the problem was that we assumed
the new request will still be in the same context, which broken various methods
on the root context or on sub-contexts.
- That will fix the getPathTranslated() to conform with the current
interpretation of the spec - the result is _different_ from what Apache, ISAPI
and NSAPI return for PATH_TRANSLATED. IMHO it's a serious bug in the spec,
but it's up to the experts to decide what's good for users.
Note that as a side effect, getPathTranslated() is no longer a simple
request attribute that you can get, but it creates a sub-request ( that
means the execution time if you call getPathTranslated() is double).
For Tocmat+Apache,IIS,NES it will create an internal request - the result
might be wrong and will be slow ( since we can't use the PATH_TRANSLATED that
is computed by the server).
- fixed 404 bug in Invoker - if a class is not found, don't send the "class not
found" exception to the ErrorServlet. ErrorServlet generates a 500 Internal
error if an exception is found.
- fixed few tests that were broken - we now pass all tomcat and watchdog tests
for servlets.

author: jluc
msg: use the latest ajpv12 from JServ1.1 final.
NB: This implies to modify, recompile the connectors to run properly.
adds ajpv12 dynamic environment variables sending. These variables are simply ignored in Tomcat.
Just here for future mod_jserv compatibility.
(useful to add SSL vars by example)
Jean-Luc Rochat
